My room was located in the furthest part of the hotel, so I didn't hear any street noises at night (except for other unruly guests, but that's not hotel's fault). 

Because my room was so dark on its own, it was great for sleeping, cos I need to have an absolute darkness for good quality sleep. 

The bathroom had a working shower and hair drier, so that covered all of my needs. I also was provided with three towels of various sizes and basic toiletries.

Location - located where La Rambla street starts.  We had a balcony & have a great view of the street with the trees & lamp posts; cabs run through the street & there is a cab stand right across the hotel.  I don't know if the cabs run through late at night or early morning.  The hotel is a walking distance from the placa catalunya, gothic quarter & passeig de gracia; at the end of this street is the beach; near shopping malls, pharmacies & foreign exchange places which make it very convenient.  There is subway & bus stop near the hotel (we did not use it so I don't know where it goes).  Despite being near a well-trafficked area, it was not noisy & did not bother our sleep.  An elevator takes you from the ground floor to the 1st floor & there is another elevator which takes you to your room.  It is a small elevator, fits 4 people or 2 people with 2 medium luggages.  Walls are thin so you can hear other guests talking.
